results.title: A Westerley aspect
results.brief_description:
Pleasant, lyrical film featuring images of the ‘countryside’ with a classical music soundtrack.

Features a calf after birth, forests and rivers. Nice green and grey colour pallette.

Good to watch.

results.title: Marmalade
results.brief_description:
Takes viewer through the process of cutting citrus fruit, cooking it and bottling it as marmalade. A woman prepares the marmalade and a male voice narrates the process.

Good titles/ ‘The End’. Nice colour.

results.title: Come September
results.brief_description:
Opens with the showgrounds devoid of people, livestock and produce, before contrasting this with the show in full swing.

Includes footage of people wandering around, livestock, produce, rides, food and ‘fun’ being had.

No narration, only location sound and upbeat music. This makes for a sophisticated and enoyable film, where the experiences of the people it captures are the focus.

Nice ‘night’ sequence with fireworks.

Great hand-painted credits that mimic various signs allready up at the showgrounds.

Great film!

results.title: Centenary of Bright
results.brief_description:
Begins with landscape shots outside of Bright, before focusing on the centenary celebrations, including crowds and reinactments of life in Bright 100 years ago. Film then follows a parade, highlighting the numerous floats involved.

Good footage of 20m high tress being cut down as part of a carnival.

Deputy Premier A.G Rylah unviels the Bright centenary Cairn, gives speech about the importnace of young people in a community.

Film nicely shot, with vibrant colours.

results.title: Flower blooming seed germinating
results.brief_description: Various unedited time-lapse footage. Shows a flower blooming and excellent footage of seeds germinating and plants breaking through soil. Also contains good leader halfway through film. Nice colours, good to watch.

results.title: Victorian review (Reel 1)
results.brief_description:
Rushes.
1. Green and open property, following a farmer on a red tractor and sheep. Overcast and dull weather.
2. Shots of a river/river banks and lanscape shots of mountains and clouds.
3. A large truck carries a house along a dirt road near a river.
4. Footage of a quary with bulldozers.
5. River.
6. Tractor pulling a machine this is cutting grass/crops.
7. Close-ups shot in a studio of various bugs climbing on the ends of branches. Also close-ups of an orange with maroon spots.

results.title: Farm tractor safety
results.brief_description:
Produced by the U.S Department of Agriculture. Follows a community as they confront the high amount of tractor-related injuries that are occuring and discover ways to counter them.

Largely set at a town meeting where addresses are given by various experts on the dangers of tractors and how to operate them safely. This culminates in an address by a man who lost both his hands in an accident.

Film contains numerous shots of tractors toppling over in varying situations.

results.title: Planet Usher: an interactive home movie
results.brief_description:
Planet Usher: An Interactive Home Movie (Patrick Tarrant, 2003) explores the stories inherent in the home-video archive of a deaf man gone slowly blind at the hands of Usher Syndrome.

Planet Usher’s success is determined by its organic marriage of form and content. Drawing on the rich aesthetic and narrative veins within the audio-visual archive, a mobile and layered narrative world is created whereby the archive is not only not lost, but in fact is dramatically re-born through an examination of the sensory deprivations that make the archive so ephemeral, and the circumstances of its production so particular.

Planet Usher unpacks the taken-for-granted relationship between sound and image in our everyday lives, whilst exploring their asynchronous relation in this instance as a source of emergent stories about a deaf man going blind. Planet Usher’s aural and visual aesthetic is low-tech high fidelity, evocatively rendering the degradation of memory, and more especially, of the physical senses as they are affected by Usher Syndrome. Finally, this project attempts to overlay the twin spaces and soundscapes of the domestic sphere and the metaphorical planet, thereby making the familiar alien, and the alien familiar.

results.title: Dirty Harry
results.brief_description:
‘Harry She’llberight’ is a lazy farmer, stuck in the ‘old ways’ of chemical spraying. He provides a ‘worst case scenario’ of chemical spray use. A representative of the Vistorian Department of Agriculture assists Harry in modern spraying techniques, equipment and safety. Along the way we are introduced to different spray epuipment and how it operates away from Harry’s farm.

Harry is a comical character and he eventually gets his act together as the film progresses.

Opening contains nice shots of people picking lettuce and scens inside of a vegetable market.

Good cartoon-like illustrations about chemical spraying safety.

results.title: Underbelly
results.brief_description: Underbelly explores the dark undercurrent of the city and the unconcious mind. Underbelly is the place between asleep and awake, where a shadow helps you navigate the quiet city streets.
